io.deepstream

Class RecordHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.deepstream.RecordHandler

    public class RecordHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements RecordEventsListener

    • Method Detail

      • getRecord

        public Record getRecord(java.lang.String name)
        Returns an existing record or creates a new one. If creating a new one the record will not be in a ready state till it is loaded from the server.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the record to get
        Returns:
        Record The record

      • getList

        public List getList(java.lang.String name)
        Returns an existing List or creates a new one. A list is a specialised type of record that holds an array of recordNames.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the list to retrieve
        Returns:
        List The List

      • getAnonymousRecord

        public AnonymousRecord getAnonymousRecord()
        Returns an anonymous record. A anonymous record is effectively a wrapper that mimicks the API of a record, but allows for the underlying record to be swapped without losing subscriptions etc.
        This is particularly useful when selecting from a number of similarly structured records. E.g. a list of users that can be choosen from a list
        The only API differences to a normal record is an additional AnonymousRecord.setName(String) method
        Returns:
        AnonymousRecord

      • listen

        public void listen(java.lang.String pattern,
          ListenListener listenCallback)
        Allows to listen for record subscriptions made by this or other clients. This is useful to create "active" data providers, e.g. providers that only provide data for a particular record if a user is actually interested in it.
        You can only listen to a pattern once, and if multiple listeners match the same pattern only a single one will be notified!
        Parameters:
        pattern - The pattern to match all records your interested in
        listenCallback - The listen callback when a match has been found or removed.

      • unlisten

        public void unlisten(java.lang.String pattern)
        Removes a listener that was previously registered with listenForSubscriptions
        Parameters:
        pattern - The pattern to stop listening to

      • snapshot

        public com.google.gson.JsonElement snapshot(java.lang.String name)
                                     throws DeepstreamError
        Retrieve the current record data without subscribing to changes
        If the record does not exist an error will be thrown
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the record which state to retrieve
        Throws:
        DeepstreamError

      • has

        public boolean has(java.lang.String name)
            throws DeepstreamError
        Allows the user to query to see whether or not the record exists
        If the record is created locally the listener will be called sync, else once the record is ready.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the record to check
        Throws:
        DeepstreamError

      • onError

        public void onError(java.lang.String recordName,
           Event errorType,
           java.lang.String errorMessage)
        Description copied from interface: RecordEventsListener
        Notified whenever an error has occurred on the record, usually due to an async operation such as a timeout or VersionConflict that can't be caught sync.
        Specified by:
        onError in interface RecordEventsListener
        Parameters:
        recordName - The name of the record an error occured to
        errorType - The error type, such as Event.ACK_TIMEOUT or Event.MESSAGE_DENIED
        errorMessage - An error message in english, describing the issue. Do not use this message other than for logging! All checks should be against errorType

      • onDestroyPending

        public void onDestroyPending(java.lang.String recordName)
        When the client calls discard or delete on a record, there is a short delay before the corresponding ACK message is received from the server. To avoid race conditions if the record is re-requested straight away the old record is removed from the cache straight awy and will only listen for one last ACK message
        Parameters:
        recordName - The name of the record being destroyed

      • onRecordDeleted

        public void onRecordDeleted(java.lang.String recordName)
        Description copied from interface: RecordEventsListener
        Notified when the record was deleted, whether by this client or by another.
        Once this is called the record object must be cleaned up and a new one created if you wish to continue setting data.
        Specified by:
        onRecordDeleted in interface RecordEventsListener
        Parameters:
        recordName - The name of the deleted record

      • onRecordDiscarded

        public void onRecordDiscarded(java.lang.String recordName)
        Description copied from interface: RecordEventsListener
        Notified once the record was discarded.
        Once this is called the record object must be cleaned up and a new one created if you wish to continue setting data.
        Specified by:
        onRecordDiscarded in interface RecordEventsListener
        Parameters:
        recordName - The name of the discarded record
